attributes.action: Save the Gloucester Park George V Bandstand from demolition:
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Built 1933-34, one of its kind: Presentation of the US Presidential Citation to Gloucester Regiment took place there, for their role in the Korean War, VE day Celebrations, Queen Mary visited a Youth Rally in the 1940’s, various bands played there. 
The Faux Victorian alternative, has been criticised by English Heritage, who say the existing Bandstand should be listed at local level, but there is no local list.  It is in line for listing as a ‘Positive Building’, but the new Conservation Area appraisals have not yet been agreed, but that would still not protect it from demolition; we need your help to save the structure.   
The Planning Committee have already refused Gloucester City Council permission to demolish the structure, but the Council found a way of bringing it before the Committee again on Tuesday 6th March 2007 seeking permission to demolish -  democracy skewed?

Les Branchett - for
GLOUCESTERSHIRE HERITAGE AND CONSERVATION HELPING TO SAVE HISTORY

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Save the Gloucester Park George V Bandstand from demolition."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page13444.asp

Prime Minister's Office
